name: ncWMS
tagline: A Web Map Service for displaying environmental data over the web
body:
## What is ncWMS?
[ncWMS](https://reading-escience-centre.gitbooks.io/ncwms-user-guide/content/) is a [Web Map Service](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_Map_Service) for displaying environmental data.

## Getting ncWMS
[ncWMS](https://reading-escience-centre.gitbooks.io/ncwms-user-guide/content/) is designed to run in a servlet container such as [Tomcat](http://tomcat.apache.org/) or [Glassfish](https://glassfish.java.net/). However, we do provide a standalone version which uses an embedded [Winstone](http://winstone.sourceforge.net/) servlet container to allow users to quickly try it out.

### Servlet container version
This is the standard version of ncWMS which most people will want to use. It can be obtained by downloading `ncWMS2.war` from [here](https://github.com/Reading-eScience-Centre/ncwms/releases/latest)

Note that you will need to configure a security role within your servlet container to be able to use this.

### Standalone version
The standalone version of ncWMS can be obtained by downloading `ncWMS2-standalone.jar` from [here](https://github.com/Reading-eScience-Centre/ncwms/releases/latest)

Note that this version is designed to be run locally and has no security for any of the administrative functions. To run a publicly-available version of ncWMS, please use the servlet container version.

## Seeing ncWMS in Action
We have a demo site for ncWMS available [here](http://godiva.rdg.ac.uk/ncWMS2/Godiva3.html).

The [Global HYCOM viewer](http://viewer.coaps.fsu.edu/GlobalHycom/mapviewer) uses ncWMS in its backend.

The [THREDDS Data Server](http://www.unidata.ucar.edu/software/thredds/current/tds/TDS.html) is packaged with a version of ncWMS for viewing THREDDS-catalogued products in a browser.

[Hyrax](http://docs.opendap.org/index.php/Hyrax) also uses ncWMS2 for visualisation.

If you are using ncWMS on a publicly-available website and would like to have it listed here, please [contact us](mailto:resc@reading.ac.uk)
